text: - Hi, I'm Titiksha Singh,

a Specialist Solutions
Architect for Amazon Connect,

an easy-to-use omnichannel
cloud contact center
provided by AWS.

Traditional contact centers
are expensive to maintain,
difficult to scale,

and even the simplest of
changes can take months to make.
We realize this at Amazon.com,

and so we built our own scalable
contact center solution,
Amazon Connect.
Amazon Connect is built
to seamlessly deliver dynamic, natural,
and personalized experiences
that enhance your customer service.
You can build high-quality voice, chat,
and self-service experiences
to support your customers from anywhere.
Amazon Connect is artificial intelligence
and machine learning enabled by default.

Meaning, it's very easy
to implement features
like automated customer interactions,

customers sentiment analysis,
caller authentications,
and you can also quickly make changes
to existing capabilities like your IVR
and your chat bot designs.

So, in the next minute,
I'm going to show you

how easy it is to set up an
Amazon Connect contact center
with just a few clicks.
Seriously, that's it.
Let me show you how.
The first step in setting up
your Amazon Connect contact center

is to create a virtual
contact center instance.
An instance contains all the resources

and settings related
to your contact center,
such as your phone numbers,
your user accounts, contact flows,
or your IVR scripts or logic,
routing and queuing configurations,

your call recordings,
your reports, et cetera.
Let's click on Create Instance.
You start by choosing how you want
to manage your user accounts.
You can store your users in Amazon Connect

or link an existing directory
to your Connect instance.
Next, you configure an administrator user
for your Amazon Connect instance.
(light music)
Now that you've added an administrator,

the next step is to configure
the telephony options
for your instance.
You choose whether you want your agents
to receive calls from customers,
make outbound calls, or both.

The next step is to configure
data storage options
for your Amazon Connect instance.
When you create an instance,

an Amazon S3 bucket is created
for your storage by default.

Your Connect data such
as your call recordings,
chat transcripts, and reports are stored
in this Amazon S3 bucket.

After reviewing your settings,
click on Create Instance.
And that's it.
In just a few clicks,

you've created your contact
center with Amazon Connect.

You can now add phone numbers
and agents to your instance.

You can configure routing,
queuing, and analytics.

You can create a contact
flow or IVR script
to define your customer experience

with your contact center
from start to finish.

You can also configure
agent assist features
such as Customer Profiles and Wisdom,

or contact center analytics
features such as Contact Lens,

or enable real-time caller
authentication with Voice ID.
All of this can be done
via a single intuitive user interface
that provides you the agility
and flexibility your business needs
to manage your contact center.

And now that you are in
the Amazon Connect instance
that you just created,
you can claim a phone number.

This is the number that
your customers will call
to reach your business.

You can select from the list
of direct inward dial numbers
or toll-free numbers from the dropdown.

So, now, I'll go ahead
and select the country,

the number type, which
is direct inward dial,

and then the first available
number from the list.
After you've claimed a phone number,
you can now place a call
to Amazon Connect's default contact flow.
I am now going to make a call
to the phone number we have just claimed
so that we can listen

to the default Amazon
Connect contact flow.
(line rings)
- [Prompt] Hello, thanks for calling.
These are some examples

of what the Amazon Connect
Virtual Contact Center
can enable you to do.
Press 1 to be put in queue for an agent,
2 to securely enter content.
- And that's it.

Amazon Connect uses a low
pay-as-you-go pricing model

with no long-term commitments,
licensing agreements,
or maintenance fees.

This means that you can create
your first contact center,

experiment with new
features and make changes,
and only pay for the amount of minutes
or chat interactions used.
Amazon Connect makes it easy

to automate customer experiences
across different channels
with skill-based routing,

powerful, real time, and
historical analytics,
and easy-to-use in intuitive tools

for your agents,
supervisors, and customers.

Amazon Connects simplifies
your contact center operations,

improves your agents' efficiency,
and lowers your costs.

In minutes, you can set up
an omnichannel contact center
enabled with machine learning
and artificial intelligence power tools,

and scale instantly to
support millions of customers
at a lower cost.

We hope you have enjoyed
this demonstration.
For more information about Amazon Connect,
please visit aws.com/connect.
